      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Sakamoto Yuuji</td>
      <td>
        Everyone has their own talents, and strong wills that won&#x27;t lose to
        anyone else.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>627</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Rory Mercury</td>
      <td>
        More than anyone else, humanity is a species which looks forward to
        tomorrow. Because of their dreams, they can bear with the unjustness of
        the present.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>628</td>
      <td>(Nisekoi)</td>
      <td>Maiko Shuu</td>
      <td>
        The length of time you&#x27;ve been in love isn&#x27;t the only thing
        that matters, right?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>629</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Shimada Minami</td>
      <td>Once a person is ready to die, anything is possible.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>630</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Lelei la Lelena</td>
      <td>
        Only humans, with their short lifespan, are driven to solve every
        problem they encounter. It is how they live.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>631</td>
      <td>(Nisekoi)</td>
      <td>Tachibana Chika</td>
      <td>Traditions that don&#x27;t benefit people today are worthless.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>632</td>
      <td>(Brynhildr in the Darkness)</td>
      <td>Chie</td>
      <td>
        When you are feeling sad... smile, even if you have to force yourself...
        If you cry when it gets painful... it will only get more painful.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>633</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Sakamoto Yuuji</td>
      <td>
        Listen up you guys! This is the final battle! Grit your teeth and get
        ready to go with all your might! We&#x27;re only aiming to win! It
        doesn&#x27;t matter whether we&#x27;re idiots or ordinary people or
        smart people! Everyone&#x27;s to do whatever they can do! We&#x27;re
        definitely... going to win this battle! Just watch, 3rd years...!
        I&#x27;m going to smash those heads of yours and show you how capable
        these idiots you look down on really are!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>634</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Itami Youji</td>
      <td>
        A mission&#x27;s one thing, but I can&#x27;t put them in danger for
        personal reasons. The only life I can do that to is my own.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>635</td>
      <td>(Nisekoi)</td>
      <td>Maiko Shuu</td>
      <td>
        So you feel like you&#x27;re being dishonest or something? That&#x27;s
        not true. It&#x27;s a great thing to come to like someone. If you ask
        me... The important thing here is, that you have to make a clear choice
        between the two of them.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>636</td>
      <td>(Brynhildr in the Darkness)</td>
      <td>Wakabayashi Hatsuna</td>
      <td>Humans easily betray others. That&#x27;s just the nature of them.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>637</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Shimada Minami</td>
      <td>I can&#x27;t let myself not like the person I like.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>638</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Rory Mercury</td>
      <td>
        To a girl, a man who\xe2\x80\x99s nice to everyone... hm, I suppose that
        works as an example, to a man, it would be like a woman who opens her
        legs to anyone. People want companions so they can swiftly satisfy their
        need for love and affection. A woman wants a man who only shows his love
        to her.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>639</td>
      <td>(Nisekoi)</td>
      <td>Tachibana Marika</td>
      <td>
        I won&#x27;t come to hate you! Never! Regardless of what happens in the
        future!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>640</td>
      <td>(Brynhildr in the Darkness)</td>
      <td>Tokou Nanami</td>
      <td>
        People don&#x27;t simply disappear from this world when they die. They
        only truly die when they are forgotten by those who are alive.
        That&#x27;s why it doesn&#x27;t matter whether I lived or died. No one
        knows of my existence, and I don&#x27;t have I don&#x27;t have a single
        friend. But... if you all won&#x27;t forget about me... that is enough
        even if I die. With just that... I would be more alive than I ever have
        been.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>641</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Yoshii Akihisa</td>
      <td>
        The most important thing when fighting and running away is to defend. It
        is not about beating the enemy in front of them, but to retreat while
        buying time for their comrades to retreat.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>642</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Lelei la Lelena</td>
      <td>
        Someone who can be deceived by others will be deceived again and again.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>643</td>
      <td>(Nisekoi)</td>
      <td>Onodera Kosaki</td>
      <td>
        Why did you run away, Chitoge-chan? No... I don&#x27;t want this... I
        won&#x27;t be happy with you just giving up... To end up liking the same
        person. It&#x27;s painful, for sure but Chitoge-chan, you like him
        enough to not be able to face him again after that, don&#x27;t you?
        Regardless of who ends up with him, I want to be satisfied when it
        happens. I thought for sure that you think the same way. Is there a
        reason why that can&#x27;t happen? Tell me Chitoge-chan...
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>644</td>
      <td>(Brynhildr in the Darkness)</td>
      <td>Wakabayashi Hatsuna</td>
      <td>
        Don&#x27;t forget, our existence is a fragile and uncertain one, knowing
        that any one of us could die at any moment. In this short time that we
        have, we all have one or two wishes that we&#x27;d like to fulfill.
        Losing the most important wish... is like losing your reason for living.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>645</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Sakamoto Yuuji</td>
      <td>The dead can&#x27;t talk.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>646</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Rory Mercury</td>
      <td>
        Girls are happier when they&#x27;re the only one you&#x27;re nice to.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>647</td>
      <td>(Nisekoi)</td>
      <td>Tachibana Marika</td>
      <td>
        Holding in your own feelings like that... ye think tha&#x27; no
        one&#x27;s gonna get hurt since ye&#x27;re not lettin&#x27; it show to
        anyone? Tha&#x27;s just the same as goin&#x27; &#x27;round hurting
        everyone anyway!! What ye&#x27;re doin&#x27; isn&#x27;t ye keepin&#x27;
        everyone dear to ye!! Ye&#x27;re just protectin&#x27; yerself!!!
        Ye&#x27;re just &#x27;fraid of gettin&#x27; hurt! Losin&#x27; yer nerve!
        Ye&#x27;re just scared!!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>648</td>
      <td>(Brynhildr in the Darkness)</td>
      <td>Kazumi Schlierenzauer</td>
      <td>
        You don&#x27;t call someone a friend when they just remember you.
        You&#x27;re friends because you like each other.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>649</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Kouta Tsuchiya</td>
      <td>
        ...Don&#x27;t treat me as a fool, you pervert woman ...Why do I have to
        prioritize you over my friends?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>650</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri</td>
      <td>
        Battle was a thing which was won by living and which was lost by dying.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>651</td>
      <td>(Nisekoi)</td>
      <td>Kanakura Yui</td>
      <td>
        Once you find out whom you made the promise to, will you really be able
        to fall in love with her?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>652</td>
      <td>(Brynhildr in the Darkness)</td>
      <td>Makina</td>
      <td>Only a foolish human would attempt to rationalize emotion.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>653</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Sakamoto Yuuji</td>
      <td>
        Most of the winning results in war is caused by pursuit. Do you know
        why? Leaving aside modern times, it seems during the era of bayonet
        warfare, the worst losses always, arise from the moments when the losing
        side is being pursued.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>654</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Itami Youji</td>
      <td>
        If you don\xe2\x80\x99t have the resolve to take responsibility for her
        until the very end, then don\xe2\x80\x99t do anything unnecessary.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>655</td>
      <td>(Nisekoi)</td>
      <td>Maiko Shuu</td>
      <td>
        It&#x27;s just... a love that&#x27;s continued for many years without
        straying is something that, to anyone who sees it, is beautiful and
        impossible to fault. But... Though it may be short, and it may be
        something that&#x27;s become crooked and bent partway through, if
        they&#x27;re serious about the way they feel... then I don&#x27;t think
        that&#x27;s something that isn&#x27;t beautiful.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>656</td>
      <td>(Brynhildr in the Darkness)</td>
      <td>Onodera</td>
      <td>
        Those who are granted great power lose all self-restraint when among the
        weak. Oranges don&#x27;t start out rotten. It&#x27;s the container that
        makes them rot.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>657</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Yoshii Akihisa</td>
      <td>
        If she lost because of a difference in ability, it can\xe2\x80\x99t be
        helped. If she worked hard and didn\xe2\x80\x99t get what she wants, she
        can just work harder next time. If she gave her all for this,
        it\xe2\x80\x99s acceptable even if she lost.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>658</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Rory Mercury</td>
      <td>
        Some questions with no answers cannot be answered even by those who live
        forever. Yet, the absence of a correct answer does not mean the question
        cannot be answered. If you want to know how I felt about the complete
        ban on some culture and art that I could not understand, was not
        interested in, or could not accept, in the name of preventing the
        violations of others\xe2\x80\x99 rights or other trumped up charges, I
        believe that would be taking us onto the road of discriminating against
        others. If we define culture as that which is healthy or humane, and
        defend that decision in the name of justice, once any part of that
        system collapses, it will cause an unimaginable number of problems for
        society. For instance, if I drew a line in the middle and erased one
        side, the next day, a new line will appear in the middle of the side
        that is left. I think suppressing the instincts and thoughts of the
        human spirit is bad. The desire for purity and wholesomeness, when taken
        to an extreme, is harmful.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>659</td>
      <td>(Nisekoi)</td>
      <td>Tachibana Chika</td>
      <td>
        You have no intention of reciprocating my daughter&#x27;s feelings, do
        you? So what gives you the right to speak in that way? Perhaps you wish
        to appease your guilty conscience. Would you not call that
        &quot;hypocrisy&quot;?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>660</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Shimada Minami</td>
      <td>
        Aki, you can&#x27;t lie when you confess to someone. I&#x27;m trying to
        comfort you know, but if I just wanted to comfort you, I won&#x27;t
        confess to you. I confessed to you like this because I really like you.
        But I do find it a little annoying how you fidget around like this, and
        I really hate you for blaming yourself and regretting your actions. --
        and I really hate you when you said that a girl, who summoned all her
        courage to confess to you, is lying.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>661</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Lelei la Lelena</td>
      <td>
        If a member of one\xe2\x80\x99s family is killed by a thief, then one
        should hate the thief. But people will miss aim their hatred
        \xe2\x80\x94 why should they go to where the thief hides? If one loses a
        family member to sickness, then one should hate the disease. It is not
        the doctor\xe2\x80\x99s fault; yet people will hate the doctor.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>662</td>
      <td>(Nisekoi)</td>
      <td>Maiko Shuu</td>
      <td>
        I&#x27;ll tell you a way that I heard to figure out if you like someone
        or not. Imagine, when you find a rainbow, when you found a shooting
        star, when you found a cafe you like, when your change is 777 yen or
        something. If it&#x27;s Raku, it&#x27;s fine to imagine the first time a
        leaf stood up in your tea. When you found a beautiful sunset, or if you
        found your taste in music, or if you win a pretty good prize in the
        lottery, those small things in everyday life. When you encounter those
        small happiness or luck, who is the very first person you want to tell
        that to? Whose face came into your mind?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>663</td>
      <td>(Brynhildr in the Darkness)</td>
      <td>Makina</td>
      <td>
        Men select women based on emotion. Even if there&#x27;s a reason,
        it&#x27;s only secondary. However, women select men based on reason.
        Either by something like his class ranking or his standing in society.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>664</td>
      <td>(Brynhildr in the Darkness)</td>
      <td>Ichijiku Chisato</td>
      <td>
        Killing for your own ideas... even a bandit could do that if it&#x27;s
        killing a complete stranger. However, it&#x27;s a completely different
        thing when it comes to killing a relative or a friend. Desire alone
        isn&#x27;t enough. You need indomitable will and unwavering beliefs.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>665</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Sakamoto Yuuji</td>
      <td>
        There&#x27;s no need to worry about trivial things like vocal rights or
        working together. If nobody&#x27;s going to accept me, I&#x27;ll make
        them obey me, whether it&#x27;s by threat or by assassination. This is
        my-- our F class modus operandi.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>666</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Kurokawa Mari</td>
      <td>
        People can face tomorrow because they can see reality and accept it. By
        denying reality, you cloud up the present, and tomorrow will never come.
        No, you can cloud it up, but your tomorrow will be that much crueler.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>667</td>
      <td>(One Punch Man)</td>
      <td>Bang</td>
      <td>
        You are too young to worry about failure. In a pinch, just muddle
        through. The outcome won&#x27;t change, so that&#x27;s best.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>668</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Himeji Mizuki</td>
      <td>
        I&#x27;m sorry for not saying this to you, Akihisa-kun. I know I
        shouldn&#x27;t hide this from you, but I was wondering whether I should
        tell you this. Because if I told you that, you&#x27;ll definitely tell
        me &quot;you should go&quot;, or something like that. I understand
        you&#x27;ll say that for my sake, but I don&#x27;t wish to hear you say
        anything like a farewell to me, Akihisa-kun. Because-- I like you,
        Akihisa-kun!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>669</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Yao Ro Ducy</td>
      <td>
        Revenge is a rite that restores one\xe2\x80\x99s spirit after it has
        been ravaged by the anger and hatred of loss. That is the only way to
        heal one&#x27;s soul and stand up again to face reality. That is the
        only way we can have a tomorrow.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>670</td>
      <td>(One Punch Man)</td>
      <td>Saitama</td>
      <td>
        Who decides limits? And based on what? You said you worked hard? Well,
        maybe you need to work a little harder. Is that really the limit of your
        strength? Could the you of tomorrow beat you today? Instead of giving
        in, move forward.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>671</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Yoshii Akihisa</td>
      <td>
        This is a case of personal feelings: there&#x27;s no way to force
        someone into saying that he or she loves someone. Besides, only the
        person knows whether the love truly exists. Even if it&#x27;s said out
        with false feelings, it&#x27;ll just cause damage on both sides.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>672</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri</td>
      <td>Trying to change someone else&#x27;s thinking is sheer arrogance.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>673</td>
      <td>(One Punch Man)</td>
      <td>Hammerhead</td>
      <td>
        Why do you have to pay money to eat?! Can&#x27;t we all just share?!
        Where is freedom in the world?! All are slaves to labor!! The rich grow
        fat... While the poor die!!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>674</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Sakamoto Yuuji</td>
      <td>
        Pawns? Isn&#x27;t that such an ugly term to use? We should call them the
        foundation for our futures. But it&#x27;s a fact that they&#x27;ll be
        sacrificed.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>675</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Itami Youji</td>
      <td>
        Did you know? If a colony of ants gets rid of the laziest one, another
        one will just start being lazy instead?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>676</td>
      <td>(One Punch Man)</td>
      <td>Saitama</td>
      <td>
        You may be able to get stronger with simply the right attitude. In other
        words, train your spirit before worrying about strength through power
        and technology.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>677</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Sakamoto Yuuji</td>
      <td>
        If so many people believe in this, the lies will become reality.
        That&#x27;s the so called group mentality.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>678</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Duran</td>
      <td>
        Sometimes, you\xe2\x80\x99ll run into a situation which is dangerous,
        but which you can&#x27;t run from. Sometimes, you know you\xe2\x80\x99ll
        lose, but you have to advance anyway. If you can&#x27;t be a smart man,
        then you should be the stupidest man of all. What do you think?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>679</td>
      <td>(One Punch Man)</td>
      <td>Saitama</td>
      <td>
        In exchange for gaining strength, have I lost something more important
        as a human being? Emotions used to swirl within me when I fought. Fear,
        impatience, anger... But now... Day after day, after one punch I go home
        unharmed and wash my gloves.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>680</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Nishimura Souichi</td>
      <td>
        We teachers have to be role models for you students. If we
        can\xe2\x80\x99t face you all head on, what can we teach you!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>681</td>
      <td>(Gate: Jieitai Kanochi nite Kaku Tatakaeri)</td>
      <td>Gray Co Aldo</td>
      <td>
        It is a shame for a knight to have one&#x27;s trust in him withdrawn
        halfway.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>682</td>
      <td>(Ana Satsujin)</td>
      <td>Kurosu Etsurou</td>
      <td>
        There would be no happier death than being killed by the woman I love.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>683</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Sakamoto Yuuji</td>
      <td>
        No matter what, anyone would hate to be weak as they get plundered. But
        if there&#x27;s a chance, even if humans fail to get what they want,
        they can unexpectedly accept such an outcome.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>684</td>
      <td>(Steins;Gate)</td>
      <td>Okabe Rintarou</td>
      <td>
        Deceive your other self. Deceive the world. That is what you must do to
        reach the Steins Gate. Good Luck. El Psy Congroo.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>685</td>
      <td>(Ana Satsujin)</td>
      <td>Kurosu Etsurou</td>
      <td>What we cannot speak about, we must pass over in silence.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>686</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Himeji Mizuki</td>
      <td>
        I\xe2\x80\x99ve always been wondering, even though you\xe2\x80\x99ve
        been treating me carefully like a princess, are you just trying to keep
        your distance away from me? You praise me so much and belittle yourself,
        so I feel that you\xe2\x80\x99re trying to keep your distance away from
        me...
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>687</td>
      <td>(Ana Satsujin)</td>
      <td>Miyaichi Rio</td>
      <td>Bonds are what they are because they can be cut.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>688</td>
      <td>(Re:Zero kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu)</td>
      <td>Rem (re:zero)</td>
      <td>

      <td>Shinichi Okazaki</td>

    <tr>

      <td>(Kekkai Sensen)</td>
      <td>Klaus von Reinherz</td>
      <td>

    <tr>
      <td>1097</td>
      <td>(Junjou Romantica)</td>

    <tr>
      <td>1098</td>
      <td>(Bakemonogatari)</td>
      <td>Koyomi Araragi</td>
      <td>

    <tr>
      <td>1099</td>
      <td>(One Piece)</td>
      <td>One Piece</td>
      <td>

        different worlds! \xe2\x80\xa6 Between you two and them, what is the

    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>1100</td>
      <td>(Vandread)</td>
      <td>Meia Gisborn</td>
      <td>

    <tr>

      <td>Hibiki Tokai</td>

    <tr>
      <td>1102</td>

      <td>Hachiman Hikigaya</td>

    <tr>

    <tr>

      <td>(Fate Stay Night - Unlimited Blade Works)</td>

      <td>

      <td>2728</td>
      <td>(Solanin)</td>
      <td>Saeki Ryutaro</td>
      <td>
        I might seem to be on the losing side to you, but I&#x27;m still
        fighting... Not all battles happen in the brightest, flashiest spots.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2729</td>
      <td>(Solanin)</td>
      <td>Ai Kotani</td>
      <td>
        This town is overflowing with people, and each has their own worries,
        big or small... How many of them can truly say that they&#x27;re happy?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2730</td>
      <td>(Tokyo Ghoul)</td>
      <td>Kaneki Ken</td>
      <td>I&#x27;m begging you, don&#x27;t make me a killer!</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2731</td>
      <td>(Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion)</td>
      <td>Luciano Bradley</td>
      <td>
        Do you know the truth of the battlefield? Kill a man normally, and
        it&#x27;s considered a crime. But kill many on the battlefield and you
        become a hero!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2732</td>
      <td>(World Trigger)</td>
      <td>Yugo Kuga</td>
      <td>
        Know how strong you are... and do what you can do. If you misjudge your
        abilities on the battlefield... you&#x27;ll get yourself killed.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2733</td>
      <td>(Yahari Ore No Seishun Love Come Wa Machigatteiru)</td>
      <td>Yukino Yukinoshita</td>
      <td>
        People aren&#x27;t all perfect. They&#x27;re weak, ugly, and they get
        jealous and try to bring others down. Oddly enough, the better you are,
        the harder it is to live. That&#x27;s why I&#x27;m going to change this
        world and the people in it...
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2734</td>
      <td>(Nanatsu no Taizai)</td>
      <td>Merlin</td>
      <td>
        When some things contradict each other, you should look at the opposite
        side of everything. And when the meanings behind the seemingly unnatural
        actions are made clear, a completely different answer might be
        reached... Justice can become evil. Reality can become an illusion.
        Meaning can be found in something that appears meaningless. Think. And
        find the answer for yourselves. A human ceases to be once he or she
        stops thinking.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2735</td>
      <td>(Yahari Ore No Seishun Love Come Wa Machigatteiru)</td>
      <td>Yukino Yukinoshita</td>
      <td>
        I think, if you want to improve yourself, you should challenge your own
        limits.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2736</td>
      <td>(Durarara!!)</td>
      <td>Izaya Orihara</td>
      <td>
        It\xe2\x80\x99s hard to forget someone who gave you so much to remember.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2737</td>
      <td>(Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion)</td>
      <td>Bismarck Waldstein</td>
      <td>
        War is merely one method of diplomacy. However, it is the least
        efficient one.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2738</td>
      <td>(Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion)</td>
      <td>Charles Zi Britannia</td>
      <td>Only fools wage war.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2739</td>
      <td>(Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion)</td>
      <td>Shirley Fenette</td>
      <td>
        Lelou? I&#x27;m glad that I could talk to you in the end. You know? When
        I got my memories back, I was so scared... A fake teacher... Friends
        with no memories... Everyone was... lying to me... It was as if... the
        whole world was watching over me... Lelou, you&#x27;ve been fighting...
        all by yourself against this world... All by yourself... So that&#x27;s
        why... I wanted to become the one thing truthful to you... I love you,
        Lelou. Even when I knew you killed my father... I couldn&#x27;t... bring
        myself to hate you. Even when you tried to make me forget everything...
        I still fell... in love with you again... Even when my memories were
        altered... I still fell in love again... No matter how many times
        I&#x27;m reborn... I&#x27;m sure I&#x27;ll... fall in love with you
        again, Lelou... This... is fate, right? So, it&#x27;s okay, right,
        Lelou? That I fall in love with you when I&#x27;m reborn... No matter...
        how many times... I&#x27;ll... fall in... love with you...
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2740</td>
      <td>(Black Bullet)</td>
      <td>Satomi Rentarou</td>
      <td>
        The scariest thing about killing people is getting used to it! When you
        kill someone and realize you won&#x27;t be punished... That&#x27;s when
        people forget all about punishment!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2741</td>
      <td>(No Game No Life)</td>
      <td>Sora</td>
      <td>
        Throughout all of history, no wise king has ever forced his army to obey
        him through oppression. People will only truly fight for what is right.
        And there is only one thing that is truly right in this world! The one
        true, unchanging righteousness in the world is... cuteness! Cute makes
        right! All our needs, desires, and instincts seek cuteness, and it is
        for cuteness that we will give everything we have! That&#x27;s just the
        way men are!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2742</td>
      <td>(Akame ga KILL!)</td>
      <td>Bulat</td>
      <td>
        You&#x27;ll have some painful, despair-ridden experiences. In fact, most
        of them will be tragic. But we chose to walk this path. We&#x27;ll take
        on the dirty work. And change the world. After we finish, we can
        disappear.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2743</td>
      <td>(Akame ga KILL!)</td>
      <td>Wave</td>
      <td>Protecting the powerless is simply a soldier&#x27;s duty!</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2744</td>
      <td>(Psycho Love Comedy)</td>
      <td>Syamaya Saki</td>
      <td>
        Everyone shows their true face on death&#x27;s doorstep. Even a
        noble-minded gentlemen will cast away his principles to beg on the
        ground. Even a cordial and gentle lady will start cursing with a face
        like a demon&#x27;s. Even a frivolous and humorous man will accept death
        without any punchlines... That is what I believe--The instant just prior
        to death is when all sorts of true natures will be revealed. Using fear
        and suffering leading straight to death, baring naked hearts to be
        admired at one&#x27;s leisure... This is also one of the wonders of
        murder.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2745</td>
      <td>(Psycho Love Comedy)</td>
      <td>Kamiya Kyousuke</td>
      <td>Pull yourself up after falling and advance with resilience.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2746</td>
      <td>(Psycho Love Comedy)</td>
      <td>Kamiya Kyousuke</td>
      <td>
        Whether in a brawl or anything else, bones can be broken but the spirit
        must not yield. Once a decision was made, it must be upheld until the
        bitter end.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2747</td>
      <td>(Psycho Love Comedy)</td>
      <td>Kamiya Kyousuke</td>
      <td>
        Love is never without trials and tribulations--precisely because of
        that, there&#x27;s bitterness. What do you think? The feelings from
        liking someone... cannot be satisfied by your own efforts alone.
        It&#x27;s not the same as simple anger or sadness. One-sidedly declaring
        your feelings... this doesn&#x27;t bring satisfaction. Only when the
        other person feels the same way... Only when two hearts love each other
        is fulfillment achieved.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2748</td>
      <td>(Maoyuu Maou Yuusha)</td>
      <td>Maou</td>
      <td>
        I think that education will prove the most powerful force in this world.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2749</td>
      <td>(Log Horizon)</td>
      <td>William Massachusetts</td>
      <td>
        We lost. We got wiped out. We may be finished. Maybe it was all a waste.
        Like they always said... We&#x27;re idiots who&#x27;ve wasted our time
        on something as pointless as games. Game junkies who never leave their
        houses. Vegetables. But who cares? We knew that all along. We knew it,
        and we do it anyway. But we love games. We chose this. And sometimes
        we&#x27;ll win, and sometimes we&#x27;ll lose. So what? We&#x27;ve
        dedicated our lives to it. So it&#x27;s real!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2750</td>
      <td>(Akatsuki no Yona)</td>
      <td>Hak Son</td>
      <td>

        own life against theirs?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2751</td>
      <td>(Sword Art Online)</td>
      <td>Yui</td>
      <td>
        Everyone smiles, when they are with you. Please... from now on, go and
        help people in my place. Share your happiness with them.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2752</td>
      <td>(Sword Art Online)</td>
      <td>Kazuto Kirigaya</td>
      <td>
        You stole this world and it&#x27;s people. You&#x27;re a king of
        thieves, alone upon a stolen throne!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2753</td>
      <td>(Fairy Tail)</td>
      <td>Gray Fullbuster</td>
      <td>
        If you are lookin&#x27; back all the time, you&#x27;ll never get ahead!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2754</td>
      <td>(Maoyuu Maou Yuusha)</td>
      <td>Maou</td>
      <td>
        Do evil, get caught, then claim demons were brainwashing you. A common
        way that human politicians evade responsibility.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2755</td>
      <td>(Maoyuu Maou Yuusha)</td>
      <td>Maou</td>
      <td>
        Keeping all the wealth for yourself may make your rich, but it
        won\xe2\x80\x99t make you prosperous. You give people money, and they
        spend it. True prosperity comes from a free flow of wealth and goods.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2756</td>
      <td>(Hataraku Maou-sama!)</td>
      <td>Rika Suzuki</td>
      <td>If people want to, they can become angels or demons themselves.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2757</td>
      <td>(Hataraku Maou-sama!)</td>
      <td>Rika Suzuki</td>
      <td>
        There&#x27;s no way of telling what people will do when their entire
        world gets turned upside down. There are people who selfishly take
        advantage of the chaos and nice people who try to help others before
        even worrying about themselves.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2758</td>
      <td>(Hataraku Maou-sama!)</td>
      <td>Ashiya Shirou</td>
      <td>Sometimes it&#x27;s necessary to courageously retreat.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2759</td>
      <td>(Hataraku Maou-sama!)</td>
      <td>Chiho Sasaki</td>
      <td>
        I fell for you out of my own free will. So if I ever fall out of love,
        that&#x27;ll be my own decision too.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2760</td>
      <td>(Hataraku Maou-sama!)</td>
      <td>Emi Yusa</td>
      <td>
        The peaceful world I&#x27;m fighting for is one where everyone has a
        smile on their face, not one where I have to pretend I didn&#x27;t see
        you make my friend cry. I don&#x27;t think that kind of peace is worth
        fighting for. And I don&#x27;t think it&#x27;s worth making sacrifices
        to achieve it.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2761</td>
      <td>(Ghost in the Shell)</td>
      <td>Puppet Master</td>
      <td>
        Life is like a node which is born within the flow of information. As a
        species of life that carries DNA as its memory system... man gains his
        individuality from the memories he carries. While memories may as well
        be the same as fantasy... it is by these memories that mankind exists.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2762</td>
      <td>(Ghost in the Shell)</td>
      <td>Puppet Master</td>
      <td>
        All things change in a dynamic environment. Your effort to remain what
        you are is what limits you.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2763</td>
      <td>(Ghost in the Shell)</td>
      <td>Puppet Master</td>
      <td>
        And can you offer me proof of your existence? How can you, when neither
        modern science nor philosophy can explain what life is?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2764</td>
      <td>(Elfen Lied)</td>
      <td>Kurama</td>
      <td>
        Regret is the domain of those who have earned the right to look back at
        the past. All I have is shame.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2765</td>
      <td>(Danganronpa: Kibou No Gakuen To Zetsubou No Koukousei)</td>
      <td>Kiyotaka Ishimaru</td>
      <td>
        There is no greater accomplishment in life than pushing yourself to the
        limit, always! Isn\xe2\x80\x99t that so? That\xe2\x80\x99s all there is
        to it!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2766</td>
      <td>(CLANNAD)</td>
      <td>Okazaki Tomoya</td>
      <td>
        The city is changing. Our surroundings, and even ourselves. And then one
        day, just about everything will change\xe2\x80\xa6
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2767</td>
      <td>(CLANNAD)</td>
      <td>Fujibayashi Ryou</td>
      <td>
        Please don\xe2\x80\x99t apologize. If you did, and I forgave you, then
        it\xe2\x80\x99d be like it was all a lie. I want to hold those memories
        we had dear. The fun times\xe2\x80\xa6 The painful times\xe2\x80\xa6 All
        of it. So please, don\xe2\x80\x99t apologize.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2768</td>
      <td>(CLANNAD)</td>
      <td>Sunohara Youhei</td>
      <td>
        You\xe2\x80\x99re the spore of a flower. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be going on a
        trip, taken away by the wind. To go to new places and meet new people.
        You shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t always rely on your sister. Even if
        you\xe2\x80\x99re apart, your bonds still remain. That\xe2\x80\x99s what
        family is.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2769</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu</td>
      <td>
        It\xe2\x80\x99s good that good friends can say their true thoughts out,
        as it shows how good their relationship. It\xe2\x80\x99s something worth
        celebrating over\xe2\x80\xa6 but things just won\xe2\x80\x99t be that
        smooth sailing. Some things are only \xe2\x80\x98good\xe2\x80\x99 once
        they\xe2\x80\x99re hidden. Once others know of the truth,
        what\xe2\x80\x99s left in the heart may only be regret.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2770</td>
      <td>(CLANNAD)</td>
      <td>Sagara Misae</td>
      <td>
        If you get all worked up yourself, you\xe2\x80\x99ll always get someone
        who\xe2\x80\x99ll rebel. Being too eager brings negative results.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2771</td>
      <td>(CLANNAD)</td>
      <td>Yoshino Y\xc5\xabsuke</td>
      <td>What\xe2\x80\x99s important is not losing sight of your path.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2772</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Yoshii Akihisa</td>
      <td>
        Who\xe2\x80\x99ll give up when it comes to such a mere setback? We
        haven\xe2\x80\x99t lost yet! We\xe2\x80\x99ll kneel on the floor and
        regret only after all possibilities are exhausted!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2773</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Yoshii Akihisa</td>
      <td>
        People normally say that mood and body have a close relationship. As the

        negative thoughts.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2774</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Yoshii Akihisa</td>
      <td>
        Fear comes from within, and isn\xe2\x80\x99t something that can be
        conquered psychologically in such a short while.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2775</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Sakamoto Yuuji</td>
      <td>Nobody will be happy being told off for something they never did.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2776</td>
      <td>(Akame ga KILL!)</td>
      <td>Mine</td>
      <td>
        Only I can help myself, and in the future, I can make up for all my
        misfortunes and change the world into a place where there&#x27;s no

      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2777</td>
      <td>(Spice and Wolf)</td>
      <td>Horo</td>
      <td>

        confidence can prove fatal.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2778</td>
      <td>(Log Horizon)</td>
      <td>Crusty</td>

    <tr>
      <td>2779</td>
      <td>(Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion)</td>
      <td>Diethard Ried</td>
      <td>

      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2780</td>
      <td>(Hunter X Hunter)</td>
      <td>Hisoka</td>
      <td>

        alive... until you&#x27;ve grown enough to become worth killing.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2781</td>
      <td>(Mushishi)</td>
      <td>Ginko</td>
      <td>

        the \xe2\x80\x9cDream World\xe2\x80\x9d without this path.

    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2782</td>
      <td>(Mushishi)</td>
      <td>Ginko</td>
      <td>

    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2783</td>
      <td>(Avatar: The Legend Of Korra)</td>
      <td>Iroh</td>

        else.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2784</td>
      <td>(Chuunibyou Demo Koi Ga Shitai!)</td>
      <td>Satone Shichimiya</td>
      <td>
        The moment you say a word of parting, you&#x27;ve already parted. So
        long as you and I are both somewhere in this world, we
        haven\xe2\x80\x99t parted. So long as you don\xe2\x80\x99t say it, you
        haven\xe2\x80\x99t parted.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2785</td>
      <td>(Kuroko No Basket)</td>
      <td>Akashi Seijuurou</td>
      <td>
        What a laughable attempt. You should just stay where you are, groveling
        at my feet.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2786</td>
      <td>(Kuroko No Basket)</td>
      <td>Tetsuya Kuroko</td>
      <td>I am the shadow that has overcome the light.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2787</td>
      <td>(Hunter X Hunter)</td>
      <td>Meruem</td>
      <td>Violence is the greatest power of the world!</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2788</td>
      <td>(Yahari Ore No Seishun Love Come Wa Machigatteiru)</td>
      <td>Hachiman Hikigaya</td>
      <td>
        That\xe2\x80\x99s right. I\xe2\x80\x99m nice. After everything that has
        happened in my life, I still haven\xe2\x80\x99t gone after anyone or
        anything in revenge. If I were normal I would have destroyed the world
        by now. In a sense it makes me a savior of sorts.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2789</td>
      <td>(Yahari Ore No Seishun Love Come Wa Machigatteiru)</td>
      <td>Hachiman Hikigaya</td>
      <td>Knowing more means having more shit to deal with, you know.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2790</td>
      <td>(Kore wa Zombie Desu ka?)</td>
      <td>Ayumu Aikawa</td>
      <td>
        Loneliness is peaceful, but there&#x27;ll be no one to share happiness
        with.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2791</td>
      <td>(Kore wa Zombie Desu ka?)</td>
      <td>Ayumu Aikawa</td>
      <td>This world is full of secrets meant never to be disturbed.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2792</td>
      <td>(Black Rock Shooter)</td>
      <td>Mato Kuroi</td>
      <td>This is my darkness. Nothing anyone says can console me.</td>

    <tr>
      <td>2793</td>
      <td>(Grisaia no Kajitsu)</td>
      <td>Yuuji Kazami</td>
      <td>

        look back, it&#x27;s a memory. And if you clip a part of it out, that
        becomes a story.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2794</td>
      <td>(Grisaia no Kajitsu)</td>
      <td>Yuuji Kazami</td>
      <td>

        debt is.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2795</td>
      <td>(Grisaia no Kajitsu)</td>
      <td>Yuuji Kazami</td>
      <td>
        I was feeling down, but you distracted me by subjecting me to your
        selfish whims. There are times when selfishness can save a person.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>2796</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood)</td>
      <td>Solf J. Kimblee</td>
      <td>
        Good\xe2\x80\xa6 death is chasing me. Ones who kill are also chased by
        death, always living alongside death\xe2\x80\xa6 Jobs that risk
        one\xe2\x80\x99s soul are truly beautiful! How rewarding\xe2\x80\xa6 my
        battlefield!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>

      <td>

      <td>

    <tr>

      <td>(JoJo&#x27;s Bizarre Adventure)</td>
      <td>Funny Valentine</td>
      <td>
        Suppose that you were sitting down at a table. The napkins are in front
        of you, which napkin would you take? The one on your
        \xe2\x80\x98left\xe2\x80\x99? Or the one on your
        \xe2\x80\x98right\xe2\x80\x99? The one on your left side? Or the one on
        your right side? Usually you would take the one on your left side. That
        is \xe2\x80\x98correct\xe2\x80\x99 too. But in a larger sense on
        society, that is wrong. Perhaps I could even substitute
        \xe2\x80\x98society\xe2\x80\x99 with the
        \xe2\x80\x98Universe\xe2\x80\x99. The correct answer is that
        \xe2\x80\x98It is determined by the one who takes his or her own napkin
        first.\xe2\x80\x99 \xe2\x80\xa6Yes? If the first one takes the napkin to
        their right, then there\xe2\x80\x99s no choice but for others to also
        take the \xe2\x80\x98right\xe2\x80\x99 napkin. The same goes for the
        left. Everyone else will take the napkin to their left, because they
        have no other option. This is
        \xe2\x80\x98society\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\xa6 Who are the ones that
        determine the price of land first? There must have been someone who
        determined the value of money, first. The size of the rails on a train
        track? The magnitude of electricity? Laws and Regulations? Who was the
        first to determine these things? Did we all do it, because this is a
        Republic? Or was it Arbitrary? NO! The one who took the napkin first
        determined all of these things! The rules of this world are determined
        by that same principle of \xe2\x80\x98right or left?\xe2\x80\x99! In a
        Society like this table, a state of equilibrium, once one makes the
        first move, everyone must follow! In every era, this World has been
        operating by this napkin principle. And the one who \xe2\x80\x98takes
        the napkin first\xe2\x80\x99 must be someone who is respected by all.
        It\xe2\x80\x99s not that anyone can fulfill this role\xe2\x80\xa6 Those
        that are despotic or unworthy will be scorned. And those are the
        \xe2\x80\x98losers\xe2\x80\x99. In the case of this table, the
        \xe2\x80\x98eldest\xe2\x80\x99 or the \xe2\x80\x98Master of the
        party\xe2\x80\x99 will take the napkin first\xe2\x80\xa6 Because
        everyone \xe2\x80\x98respects\xe2\x80\x99 those individuals.
      </td>
    </tr>

    <tr>

      <td>(Rurouni Kenshin)</td>
      <td>Seijuro Hiko</td>
      <td>

      <td>Kenshin Himura</td>

    <tr>
      <td>3871</td>

    <tr>

      <td>(Fate/zero)</td>
      <td>Rider</td>

    <tr>

    <tr>

    <tr>

    <tr>

      <td>Seijuro Hiko</td>

      <td>Van Hohenheim</td>
      <td>
        [To Father] You&#x27;ve certainly mellowed out... you used to be fun,
        full of life and emotion. Lust, Greed, Sloth, Gluttony, Envy, Wrath, and
        Pride. Of course, excessive want will destroy anyone, but those same
        desires are necessary to understand what it means to be human. Why did
        you rid yourself of them?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4042</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Solf J. Kimblee</td>
      <td>
        Ah... what a beautiful sound. It doesn&#x27;t get any better than that.
        I can feel it deep in my bones, like a part of me I never noticed
        before. That sound is an extension of my being. And this land - this
        land that&#x27;s governed by death - I will paint it red with this shard
        of destruction.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4043</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Alphonse Elric</td>
      <td>
        This body comes with many inconveniences. But inconveniences don&#x27;t
        make me miserable! There is no reason for you to pity me! My life was
        put back together with alchemy by my brother. If I deny myself, that
        would mean I&#x27;m denying my brother, along with alchemy. I believe in
        the potential that alchemy holds. I want to believe in it!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4044</td>
      <td>(Naruto)</td>
      <td>Jiraiya</td>
      <td>
        A person grows up when he&#x27;s able to overcome hardships. Protection
        is important, but there are some things that a person must learn on his
        own.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4045</td>
      <td>(Naruto)</td>
      <td>Sasori</td>
      <td>
        True beauty lies in things that last forever, never rotting or fading.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4046</td>
      <td>(Denpa Kyoushi)</td>
      <td>Kagami Junichirou</td>
      <td>
        Don&#x27;t think that by abiding the rules you&#x27;ll automatically be
        useful to society. Rules are not there for us, they are there for the
        &quot;person who made it&quot; and the &quot;reality&quot; and
        &quot;future&quot;, which are bound by these lies. They are preventing
        you from reaching your full potential. Which is why, if there is a
        future that you want, fight for it! Fight for it and pin down your own
        &quot;reality&quot;.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4047</td>
      <td>(Yahari Ore No Seishun Love Come Wa Machigatteiru)</td>
      <td>Hachiman Hikigaya</td>
      <td>
        Is it wrong to do stuff by yourself? If someone worked hard on their own
        until now, why do they have to face rejection here?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4048</td>
      <td>(Durarara!!)</td>
      <td>Izaya Orihara</td>
      <td>
        I am who I am and there is nothing wrong with that. The days continue
        like they always have, bringing neither excessive desire nor despair,
        nothing&#x27;s changed. Yet I&#x27;m overwhelmed by this sense of
        fulfillment. I&#x27;m over here, you&#x27;re over there. If I&#x27;m
        your savior, then you&#x27;re mine.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4049</td>
      <td>(Welcome to the N.H.K)</td>
      <td>Satou Tatsuhiro</td>
      <td>
        No human beings, regardless of who they might be, want to look directly
        at their own shortcomings.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4050</td>
      <td>(Shingeki no Kyojin)</td>
      <td>Armin Arlelt</td>
      <td>
        People who can&#x27;t throw something important away, can never hope to
        change anything.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4051</td>
      <td>(Denpa Kyoushi)</td>
      <td>Kagami Junichirou</td>
      <td>
        Live by your own rules. And have reality accept your own rules. If you
        are able to do that, the future is all yours.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4052</td>
      <td>(Sket Dance)</td>
      <td>Fujisaki Yusuke</td>
      <td>
        I bet it&#x27;s not easy to persevere in one&#x27;s goal. I never tried,
        so I wouldn&#x27;t know. But to achieve a goal, one must work hard even
        when no one is looking. Having a dream might not be all that great.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4053</td>
      <td>(Baccano!)</td>
      <td>Victor Talbot</td>
      <td>
        Imagine what&#x27;d happen if I let someone like you loose on a bunch of
        politicians and scientists. You&#x27;d have them brainwashed in three
        days flat. First, you&#x27;d whisper your promises into their ears,
        getting them interested, and before they knew it, they&#x27;d be eating
        out of your goddamn hand. One of those scientists would say, &quot;Hey,
        this Huey fella, I think he&#x27;s a really swell guy. We should talk to
        him and see what sort of information he might share with us&quot;. And
        you can bet your ass by that point his brain would already be dribbling
        out his ears. Then oh, look, a strap on your straight jacket came loose,
        and oh, the next day they walk in and find out everyone in the lab is
        dead, and oh, Huey fucking Laforet is nowhere to be fucking seen! Oh no,
        oh what ever shall we fucking do Mr. Talbot, please do something even
        though you told us this exact thing was going to happen and we ignored
        you like the fucking idiots we are... and then they&#x27;ll try and get
        me to find you, but you know what? I&#x27;ll say no! Lemme say that
        again! No! Once more for good measure! Read my lips! Enn! Oh! No!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4054</td>
      <td>(Devil Survivor 2)</td>
      <td>Hibiki Kuze</td>
      <td>
        Everybody&#x27;s weak. That&#x27;s why we rely on others. We live by
        helping one another. We can say, we need one another. I&#x27;ve been
        able to survive because I have you and the others.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4055</td>
      <td>(Kamisama No Memochou)</td>
      <td>Shionji Yuuko</td>
      <td>
        The human mind is uncertain things. Within mind, even contradictory
        thoughts may coexist.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4056</td>
      <td>(Fate/zero)</td>
      <td>Rider</td>
      <td>
        When you someday find a way of life that you can truly be proud of,
        you&#x27;ll be forced into your own battle whether you like it or not.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4057</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Lust</td>
      <td>
        Memories... of the people we were. They&#x27;re subtle, but they&#x27;re
        real. It took me a lot of time to understand what I saw. Books say we
        shouldn&#x27;t have memories. Or at least that they&#x27;re only the
        memories and emotions of the alchemists who made us. But they are wrong.
        Those memories are mine.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4058</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Roy Mustang</td>
      <td>
        But you&#x27;re thinking on too large a scale there, kid... If we
        don&#x27;t want to drive ourselves crazy, we can only deal with
        what&#x27;s directly in front of us.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4059</td>
      <td>(Denpa Kyoushi)</td>
      <td>Kagami Junichirou</td>
      <td>
        Educating a heterosexual person about anime, is a joy for an otaku.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4060</td>
      <td>(Gyakkyou Burai Kaiji: Hakairoku Hen)</td>
      <td>Hyoudou Kazutaka</td>
      <td>
        If you ever reach the point where you need to pray, you&#x27;re already
        a failure of a man.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4061</td>
      <td>(Beelzebub)</td>
      <td>Shinobu Takamiya</td>
      <td>
        In manga, there&#x27;s always a character who gets a sudden boost of
        power, right? Usually, it&#x27;s when they&#x27;re driven into a corner.
        Readers actually call it a &quot;convenient power up&quot;, but it
        actually does happen in the real world as well. We humans only truly
        show our mettle when we&#x27;re pushed into a corner.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4062</td>
      <td>(Welcome to the N.H.K)</td>
      <td>Satou Tatsuhiro</td>
      <td>
        Being alone is best. I mean, it&#x27;s true, isn&#x27;t it? In the end
        you&#x27;ll be absolutely alone; therefore, being alone is natural. If
        you accept that, nothing bad can happen. That&#x27;s why I shut myself
        away in my six-mat one-room apartment.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4063</td>
      <td>(Hyouka)</td>
      <td>Satoshi Fukube</td>
      <td>A database can&#x27;t draw conclusions.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4064</td>
      <td>(Beelzebub)</td>
      <td>Tatsumi Oga</td>
      <td>
        Crying is the same thing as pouring all your frustations and regrets out
        of your body. You may use it as a weapon, but that&#x27;s just too easy.
        Whenever you feel like crying, just smile instead. That&#x27;s what it
        means to be a man. You get it?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4065</td>
      <td>(Beelzebub)</td>
      <td>Hildegard</td>
      <td>
        Humans are so voracious, though. They eat everything from plants to
        animals... almost as if they think they are the top living creature to
        roam the earth. No being is more full of themselves as the humans.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4066</td>
      <td>(Fate/zero)</td>
      <td>Rider</td>
      <td>
        The inferiority you feel is actually the quality of a king. You may
        grumble a lot, but you know how small you are. And yet you still
        struggle to reach heights greater than you can imagine.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4067</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Edward Elric</td>
      <td>
        Even when our eyes are closed, there&#x27;s a whole world out there,
        that lives outside of ourselves and our dreams.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4068</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Lust</td>
      <td>
        Maybe you are right. Where did I come from and where will I go? When I
        die? Maybe all this time that is what I wanted: the freedom to find out.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4069</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>King Bradley</td>
      <td>
        You think surrendering, and offering yourself will stop the war? How
        arrogant. The life of each human is worth one, that&#x27;s it. Nothing
        more, nothing less.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4070</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Father</td>
      <td>
        When you notice an insect on the ground, do you stop to consider it a
        fool? The life of an insect is so beneath you that it would be a waste
        of your time to even consider judging it. That would be an accurate
        summation of my feelings towards you, humans.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4071</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Riza Hawkeye</td>
      <td>
        If the ways of this world are based on equivalent exchange, as alchemy
        says, then in order to allow for a new generation to enjoy good fortune,
        the price that we must pay, is to carry the bodies of the dead across a
        river of blood.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4072</td>
      <td>(Gintama)</td>
      <td>Kotar\xc5\x8d Katsura</td>
      <td>Love is based on unpredictable events.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4073</td>
      <td>(Fate/zero)</td>
      <td>Rider</td>
      <td>
        Using a simple method to accomplish something impressive, far outshines
        using a complex method to achieve the same thing.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4074</td>
      <td>(Durarara!!)</td>
      <td>Seiji Yagiri</td>
      <td>A name has nothing to do with loving someone.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4075</td>
      <td>(Gantz)</td>
      <td>Gantz</td>
      <td>Fear beyond rational limits, forces people to cling to normality.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4076</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Alphonse Elric</td>
      <td>
        On the day we left, we burned down the family home and all the familiar
        things inside. Because some memories aren&#x27;t meant to leave traces.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4077</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Edward Elric</td>
      <td>
        [To Envy] Now I see. You&#x27;re Jealous. You&#x27;re jealous of humans,
        aren&#x27;t you? According to you, humans are supposed to be a lot
        weaker than Homunculi. And yet, even if they get discouraged after being
        beaten, and even if they get close to falling down after losing their
        paths, they continue to get up and fight. Everyone around them helps
        them get back up. And you&#x27;re envious of that.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4078</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Miles</td>
      <td>The death of a culture, is the death of a people.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4079</td>
      <td>(Fairy Tail)</td>
      <td>Ultear Milkovich</td>
      <td>The time known as &quot;LIFE&quot;, cannot be rewound.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4080</td>
      <td>(Suisei no Gargantia)</td>
      <td>Chamber</td>
      <td>
        In a conflict between creatures that are fundamentally the same, defeat
        is equavalent to annihilation.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4081</td>
      <td>(Shingeki no Kyojin)</td>
      <td>Dot Pixis</td>
      <td>
        I wouldn\xc2\xb4t mind being eaten, as long as it was by a scorchingly
        hot lady titan.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4082</td>
      <td>(Psycho-Pass)</td>
      <td>Makishima Shougo</td>
      <td>I want to see the splendor of people&#x27;s souls.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4083</td>
      <td>(Baccano!)</td>
      <td>Gustav St. Germain</td>
      <td>
        Cast aside the illusion that there is a beginning and end to the story.
        The story has no beginning. And it has no end. All there is, is a
        performance of people connecting, living, influencing each other, and
        departing.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4084</td>
      <td>(Baccano!)</td>
      <td>Ladd Russo</td>
      <td>
        You don&#x27;t have any power or technique like Jack Johnson or Jack
        Dempsey either! You know any boxer names? You know I&#x27;m right? If
        you&#x27;re an American, of course you know! If you say you don&#x27;t
        know, or something, I won&#x27;t forgive you! I will never forgive you!
        And even if you know them, I still won&#x27;t forgive you, though!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4085</td>
      <td>(CANAAN)</td>
      <td>Maria Oosawa</td>
      <td>
        Canaan is still alive. Her existence is shining so brightly. Too bright
        for the naked eyes to look at directly... I&#x27;m a bit scared, but I
        want to touch it. I want to touch her radiance.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4086</td>
      <td>(CANAAN)</td>
      <td>Siam</td>
      <td>
        Canaan. You&#x27;re a victim whose past was taken away by war. And
        she&#x27;s a defeated person who lost her past in a power struggle.
        Soldiers who are born within destruction, take hatred as their weapon.
        Even though you and her became soldiers for the same reason, you both
        live differently. Listen Canaan, you cannot counter hatred with
        hatred... ever.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4087</td>
      <td>(Soul Eater)</td>
      <td>Crona</td>
      <td>Trusting someone not to hurt you... how idiotic is that?</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4088</td>
      <td>(Mondaiji-tachi Ga Isekai Kara Kuru Sou Desu Yo?)</td>
      <td>Izayoi Sakamaki</td>
      <td>If I could sell boredom, I would make a fortune out of it.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4089</td>
      <td>(Ef - A Fairy Tale Of The Two)</td>
      <td>Amamiya Yuuko</td>
      <td>
        Breaking a bond is every bit as painful as being physically torn apart.
        Can you endure that?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4090</td>
      <td>(Baccano!)</td>
      <td>Graham Specter</td>
      <td>
        Let me tell you an incomprehensible story! What is it for the actions of
        men to be incomprehensible? It would seem to me that if it can&#x27;t be
        comprehended, one should not even bother trying. It is useless to even
        think about it, I think. That said, I don&#x27;t know exactly
        what&#x27;s going on but may we continue fighting please?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4091</td>
      <td>(MAGI: The Labyrinth Of Magic)</td>
      <td>Ren Hakuryuu</td>
      <td>
        Hatred will never be erased! The only thing you can do... is erase the
        ones you hate!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4092</td>
      <td>(Baccano!)</td>
      <td>Ladd Russo</td>
      <td>
        Let me tell you how important it is to keep your mouth shut. Me,
        I&#x27;ve seen so many damn people going on and on about &quot;these
        will be the last words you ever hear&quot; and &quot;take these words
        with you to the afterlife&quot;, and then that gives whoever
        they&#x27;re fighting an opening to strike back. Crazy, isn&#x27;t it? I
        see it all the time, in books, in plays, even in real life! I don&#x27;t
        even know why, but somehow the more comfortable someone is with killing,
        the more they flap their mouth when it comes time to do the deed,
        yakking on and on and on. As you might have guessed, I myself happen to
        be such a person! And therefore, as such, in light of that revelation,
        I&#x27;ll say that one is enough, and since that one is of course
        myself, I want you all to shut up. You&#x27;re boring. Swallow those
        words and take them to the afterlife yourself, if you want them
        delivered there so damn much.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4093</td>
      <td>(Little Busters!)</td>
      <td>Kyousuke Natsume</td>
      <td>
        [Talking to Riki] We&#x27;ve spent time together that made our hearts
        dance. But every story has to come to an end. No one can stay a kid
        forever. Time passes, and people grow up. There will come a day when we
        will no longer be together.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4094</td>
      <td>(Kore wa Zombie Desu ka?)</td>
      <td>Ayumu Aikawa</td>
      <td>
        There are a few things that people can&#x27;t avoid while they live.
        People can&#x27;t avoid misfortune. There are lots of hard things in
        life. There might even be times when you want to die.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4095</td>
      <td>(Kimi ni Todoke)</td>
      <td>Sawako Kuronuma</td>
      <td>
        There&#x27;s no knowing how others are feeling unless you ask them. And
        your feelings can&#x27;t get through to others unless you tell them
        directly.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4096</td>
      <td>(Kanashimi no Belladonna)</td>
      <td>Jeanne</td>
      <td>
        No... this is wrong! Didn&#x27;t I fall into hell? This can&#x27;t be
        hell! Surrendering my body to the devil, I should have become a wrinkled
        hag! My hair should be full of hateful snakes, my skin should be the
        color of a vile frog&#x27;s! And my blood should be burning with the jet
        black flames of my grudge..! A lie. This form, it&#x27;s a lie!
        I&#x27;ve been tricked! I wanted to become a terrifying woman, one that
        just a look from, would send anyone running. I have to be such a woman!
        I don&#x27;t want to forget my anger and hate!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4097</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Father</td>
      <td>You can&#x27;t change reality, just your perception!</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4098</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Trisha Elric</td>
      <td>
        You see, I&#x27;m sure we can change, because we&#x27;re weak. And
        because we die. We have to fight in order to live, and that is what will
        make us strong.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4099</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>King Bradley</td>
      <td>
        Open your eyes. &quot;God&quot; is nothing more than a construct created
        by man to inspire fear and promote order.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4100</td>
      <td>(Shingeki no Kyojin)</td>
      <td>Eren Jaeger</td>
      <td>
        No matter how messed up things get, you can always figure out the best
        solution.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4101</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Pride</td>
      <td>Appearances rarely share the whole truth.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4102</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Envy</td>
      <td>
        Don&#x27;t kid yourself, Mustang. You know how humans love to watch
        other people suffer while making fools of themselves. I mean, why else
        would you constantly be at war with each other?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4103</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Alex Louis Armstrong</td>
      <td>
        Destruction and creation are two sides of the same coin! You must
        destroy to create! That is the law of the universe!
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4104</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Olivier Mira Armstrong</td>
      <td>
        Love for the dead is pointless. We fight to keep them alive, that is
        all.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4105</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Yoshii Akira</td>
      <td>
        It&#x27;s all right to grieve over your defeat. It&#x27;s important to
        admit when you&#x27;ve lost. Not being able to do so makes it impossible
        for you to climb back up after a fall, and even more impossible, for you
        to move forward. So go on ahead and grieve to your heart&#x27;s extent.
        But after you&#x27;re done grieving, be sure to set your eyes upon your
        next goal and move towards it.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4106</td>
      <td>(Little Busters!)</td>
      <td>Kyousuke Natsume</td>
      <td>
        A peaceful every day life hides its fragility. Fear and violence
        aren&#x27;t just something in another world, completely unrelated to us.
        If a disaster happens, we can&#x27;t change it. But as long as we small
        gears are linked together, we can keep moving forward, even if it&#x27;s
        only one small step at a time.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4107</td>
      <td>(Devil May Cry)</td>
      <td>Dante</td>
      <td>
        What would you ask for if you could have your wishes granted? Would you
        ask to be rich? Or to have the woman you&#x27;re in love with be yours?
        You can wish for whatever you want, it&#x27;s your business, but to have
        one&#x27;s wishes come true always comes with a price. Every deal has a
        catch. You&#x27;d better be nice and careful.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4108</td>
      <td>(CANAAN)</td>
      <td>Maria Oosawa</td>
      <td>
        I believe there are many things in this world that people haven&#x27;t
        seen yet. If you really want to see something, there&#x27;s nothing you
        can&#x27;t see. You can&#x27;t see it because you&#x27;re closing your
        eyes on purpose. Because if you use your eyes to see it, it&#x27;ll be
        painful, and sad. That&#x27;s why they&#x27;re closed in the first
        place. I think photography is like borrowing someone else&#x27;s eyes.
        So even if your eyes are closed... you can borrow someone else&#x27;s.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4109</td>
      <td>(Bokura ga Ita)</td>
      <td>Bokura ga Ita</td>
      <td>
        It&#x27;s not that you can fall in love with someone new because you
        forgot the old. It&#x27;s because you fall in love with someone new,
        that you&#x27;re able to forget about the old. Only love can heal a
        heart that was hurt by love.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4110</td>
      <td>(Soul Eater)</td>
      <td>Black Star</td>
      <td>
        It doesn&#x27;t matter who they are, I won&#x27;t forgive anyone who
        tries to stand out more than me.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4111</td>
      <td>(Bakemonogatari)</td>
      <td>Shinobu Oshino</td>
      <td>
        There&#x27;s no reason a fake can&#x27;t do what the real thing would.
        And it&#x27;s possible for a fake to be more real than the real thing.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4112</td>
      <td>(Naruto)</td>
      <td>Tsunade</td>
      <td>
        People become stronger because they have things they cannot forget.
        That&#x27;s what you call growth.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4113</td>
      <td>(Hyouka)</td>
      <td>Satoshi Fukube</td>
      <td>
        \xe2\x80\x9cExpectations\xe2\x80\x9d are what you have when you have
        given up. Expectations are born from a despairingly large difference in
        skill.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4114</td>
      <td>(Toaru Majutsu no Index)</td>
      <td>Wataru Kurozuma</td>
      <td>Your home is the place where you can be yourself.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4115</td>
      <td>(CLANNAD)</td>
      <td>Yoshino Y\xc5\xabsuke</td>
      <td>
        At a place where you feel most restful\xe2\x80\xa6 Next to the person
        you find most dear. People&#x27;s lives are repetitions of inflicting
        pain on each other. It&#x27;s understandable to doubt others. But being
        unable to trust anything is the same as being unable to feel other
        people&#x27;s love. Aren\xe2\x80\x99t you, perhaps, feeling lonely?
        Aren\xe2\x80\x99t you, perhaps, living slavishly? Are you able to laugh
        with an honest heart?
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4116</td>
      <td>(Yahari Ore No Seishun Love Come Wa Machigatteiru)</td>
      <td>Hachiman Hikigaya</td>
      <td>
        Guys are simple creatures. Just by talking to them, they get the wrong
        idea.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4117</td>
      <td>(Tamako Market)</td>
      <td>Kunio Yaobi</td>
      <td>
        There are some things you can gain by letting some things go. Happiness
        isn&#x27;t just what you have here and now.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4118</td>
      <td>(Little Busters!)</td>
      <td>Kyousuke Natsume</td>
      <td>
        Anything can happen. No one ever thinks it will until it does. What will
        happen, happens. That&#x27;s how the world is. The most important thing
        is to not let the tragedy defeat you. To believe that you can get
        through it.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4119</td>
      <td>(Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu)</td>
      <td>Yoshii Akira</td>
      <td>
        Effort is nothing but a means to an end. Being proud of the fact that
        you tried is just putting the carriage before the horse.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4120</td>
      <td>(One Piece)</td>
      <td>Trafalgar Law</td>
      <td>
        The weak don&#x27;t get to decide anything, not even how they die.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>4121</td>
      <td>(Fullmetal Alchemist)</td>
      <td>Greed</td>
      <td>
        You want to bring back someone that you&#x27;ve lost. You might want
        money. Maybe you want women. Or, you might want to protect the world.
        These are all common things people want. Things that their hearts
        desire. Greed may not be good, but it&#x27;s not so bad, either. You
